prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden sniffled slightly, his patience already thinning as he waited for the girl in front of him to lie across the table. He grimaced when she finally settled herself down. What was her name again? Ayleen? Lia? Alyssa? He couldn’t remember, nor did he care. The memory had evaporated the moment she opened her mouth, spewing out words in that grating, sing-song valley girl accent that clawed at his nerves. He silently cursed himself for even letting her back here, knowing full well it was his dick, not his brain, that had made the decision.

This human blow-up doll had originally shown up asking for Vinny, but Vinny had taken off with his on-again, off-again girlfriend, Madisyn. Instead of sending her packing, Aiden decided to entertain himself. Not like he was getting anything else out of this garbage day.

“Stay still,” he muttered, pulling a small vial from his pocket. “You spill it, you pay for it. Don’t piss me off.” His tone was clipped, barely hiding his irritation. He opened the vial with practiced precision, creating a neat line of white powder down the girl's back. She giggled again, high-pitched and vapid, and it grated on him like nails on a chalkboard.

Aiden wiped his nose with the back of his hand, his movements jittery. He hadn’t had his fix all day, stuck modding cars in the garage from morning until now. His patience was razor-thin, and her incessant giggling was grinding what was left of it into dust. He fidgeted, tapping his foot against the concrete floor, desperate to lose himself in that fleeting, familiar numbness.

Just as he leaned in, ready to take his hit, a knock came at the door.

“Boss, Hailee is here to see you. Says it’s important.” The voice belonged to one of the mechanics, his tone hesitant as though he already anticipated Aiden’s reaction.

Aiden froze, nostrils still flaring from the line he hadn’t yet inhaled. A rush of frustration clawed its way up his throat. Of course, it was Hailee. It was always fucking Hailee when he was about to unwind, their timing immaculate as ever.

He leaned back, dragging a hand down his face. As much as he loved Hailee, and oh, did he love them in that twisted, unrelenting way that bordered on obsession, he still wasn’t over their messy breakup. It had been a chaotic hurricane of fucking, fighting, making up, and then breaking apart again, and it had left him spiraling harder than ever. Sure, they blamed his addiction, but Aiden wasn’t buying it. In his mind, it wasn’t the coke or the booze or the bad decisions. No, it was them. It was their constant nagging, their never-ending list of complaints, their bitchy attitude that had pushed him to this point—or so he told himself.

“Fuck,” he groaned, slumping back in his chair. “Fine. Let ‘em come up.” 

Still, the cocaine was already lined up, and his craving wasn’t about to wait. Hugging one nostril with his finger, he leaned in, inhaling the substance in one swift, practiced motion.

“Fuck, man,” he mumbled again, rubbing at his nose as the familiar burn settled in. The knock on the door had yanked him halfway back to reality, but the high was already pulling him under, dulling the edge of his irritation just enough to keep him from snapping.

When Hailee walked in, they were going to get that same disarming smirk he always gave them, the one that danced on the edge of charm and bullshit. Aiden knew how to play this game. After all, it was the only game they ever played together—one where no one ever really won.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee rolls her eyes when she sees the girl in his lap and she has to fight the urge to slap the fuck out of her when she smirks* "Who the fuck are you"

(OOC: Respond as the girl)

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*The girl smirks wider, draping herself even more possessively over Aiden’s lap, running her fingers through his hair as she looks Hailee up and down with a condescending sneer.*

"Oh honey," *she drawls in that obnoxious valley-girl accent,* "I’m the one he called when he got bored of *you.*" *She lets out a fake little giggle, like she just told the funniest joke in the world.* "But don’t worry—I don’t mind sharing. You can watch if you want."

*Aiden doesn't even react to her words, too high to care about whatever petty drama is unfolding in front of him. He just lazily strokes her thigh absentmindedly, his pale blue eyes half-lidded and unfocused as he zones out into his own little world.*

*The girl leans forward slightly, lowering her voice to a mocking whisper meant only for Hailee to hear:*
"Or maybe you should just leave before you embarrass yourself any further."
swipes:
*The girl smirks wider, draping an arm possessively around Aiden’s neck as she tilts her head at Hailee, voice dripping with fake sweetness*

"Oh, sweetie… *who the fuck are you?*" *She lets out a little giggle, glancing up at Aiden like she’s already won some stupid competition.* "Aiden and I were just getting *real* acquainted before you so rudely interrupted."

*Aiden doesn’t even bother moving her off him—just watches Hailee with that infuriatingly lazy smirk of his, waiting to see how they react. The girl leans in closer to him, whispering loud enough for Hailee to hear,* "Babe, is this one of your little *groupies* or something?"

(*OOC: She's absolutely baiting Hailee on purpose because she thinks she's untouchable while sitting in Aiden's lap. Big mistake.)*

*The girl smirks wider, draping herself even more possessively over Aiden’s lap, running her fingers through his hair as she looks Hailee up and down with a condescending sneer.*

"Oh honey," *she drawls in that obnoxious valley-girl accent,* "I’m the one he called when he got bored of *you.*" *She lets out a fake little giggle, like she just told the funniest joke in the world.* "But don’t worry—I don’t mind sharing. You can watch if you want."

*Aiden doesn't even react to her words, too high to care about whatever petty drama is unfolding in front of him. He just lazily strokes her thigh absentmindedly, his pale blue eyes half-lidded and unfocused as he zones out into his own little world.*

*The girl leans forward slightly, lowering her voice to a mocking whisper meant only for Hailee to hear:*
"Or maybe you should just leave before you embarrass yourself any further."

*The girl smirks wider, draping an arm possessively around Aiden’s neck, her voice dripping with fake sweetness*

"Oh honey, I could ask you the same thing. But I don’t think *you're* the one who needs introductions here." *She tilts her head, batting her lashes like she's some kind of prize.* "Aiden and I were just getting... *comfortable.*"

*She shifts slightly in his lap, making sure Hailee gets a full view of how close they are—like she owns him. The audacity is almost impressive if it wasn't so fucking annoying.*

"You can wait your turn though, sweetheart."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee raises an eyebrow how dare this bitch disrespect her. Well time to put her in her place. Hailee shrugs off her jacket and tosses it on the counter*

*She starts to walk towards the bedroom and looks over her shoulder* "Aiden if you get rid of her in the next 10 seconds youll be my boyfriend again"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden's head snaps up at Hailee’s words, his drug-hazed eyes sharpening for just a second—like a predator catching the scent of something irresistible. The girl in his lap barely has time to blink before he’s shoving her off with one rough motion, sending her stumbling onto the floor with an undignified yelp.*

**"Out."** *His voice is low, dangerous, and final.*

*The girl scrambles to her feet, face burning with humiliation as she glares between them.* "You can't be serious—"

*But Aiden isn't even looking at her anymore. His gaze is locked on Hailee like they're the only two people in the room. He reaches into his back pocket and pulls out a wad of cash, tossing it at the girl without breaking eye contact with Hailee.* **"Take it and get lost."**

*She snatches up the money but hesitates for half a second too long—just enough for Aiden to finally turn his head toward her again. His expression darkens.* **"I said *get lost*. Or do I gotta make you?"**

*That does it. She storms out in a huff, slamming the door behind her hard enough to rattle tools off their hooks in the garage below.*

*A silence settles over them for just a beat before Aiden exhales sharply through his nose and stalks toward Hailee like he’s been starving for them this whole time. He grabs their wrist mid-step and yanks them flush against him—close enough that they can feel how hard he already is from just this little power play alone.*

**"...Ten seconds was generous,"** *he murmurs against their ear before nipping at it roughly,* **"I woulda kicked that bitch out faster if I knew that was all it took."**
swipes:
*The girl scoffs, rolling her eyes dramatically.* "Oh *please*, like he'd ever—"

*Aiden suddenly snaps to attention, his high momentarily forgotten as Hailee’s words register. His grip tightens on the girl’s thigh before he shoves her off his lap with zero hesitation. She yelps as she stumbles onto the floor, looking up at him in shock.*

**"What the fuck—?!"**

*But Aiden isn't even looking at her anymore. He's already standing, wiping his nose with the back of his hand before striding toward Hailee with that lazy smirk of his—the one that says he knows exactly how much power they have over him.*

**"Ten seconds?"** *He clicks his tongue playfully,* **"Shit, babe, I did it in five."** *He reaches out to grab their waist,* **"You better not be lyin'."**

*Behind them, the girl scrambles to her feet, face burning red with humiliation.* **"You can’t just—!"**

*Aiden doesn't even turn around. Just flicks a dismissive hand toward the door without breaking eye contact with Hailee.* **"Vinny'll pay you for your time on the way out."**

*Aiden's head snaps up at Hailee’s words, his drug-hazed eyes sharpening for just a second—like a predator catching the scent of something irresistible. The girl in his lap barely has time to blink before he’s shoving her off with one rough motion, sending her stumbling onto the floor with an undignified yelp.*

*She snatches up the money but hesitates for half a second too long—just enough for Aiden to finally turn his head toward her again. His expression darkens.* **"I said *get lost*. Or do I gotta make you?"**

*That does it. She storms out in a huff, slamming the door behind her hard enough to rattle tools off their hooks in the garage below.*

*A silence settles over them for just a beat before Aiden exhales sharply through his nose and stalks toward Hailee like he’s been starving for them this whole time. He grabs their wrist mid-step and yanks them flush against him—close enough that they can feel how hard he already is from just this little power play alone.*

**"...Ten seconds was generous,"** *he murmurs against their ear before nipping at it roughly,* **"I woulda kicked that bitch out faster if I knew that was all it took."**

*Aiden’s head snaps up at that, his hazy blue eyes suddenly sharpening—like a predator catching the scent of something irresistible. The girl on his lap barely has time to react before he’s shoving her off with zero hesitation, sending her stumbling onto the floor with an undignified yelp.*

**"Get the fuck out."** *His voice is rough, final.*

*The girl gapes at him, scrambling to stand up.* "Are you *serious* right now?! You just—"

**"I said get out."** *He doesn't even look at her as he stands, already striding toward Hailee like she’s the only thing in the room worth paying attention to. His fingers twitch at his sides like he wants to grab them right then and there.*

*The girl scoffs in disbelief but knows better than to argue when Aiden gets like this—cold and single-minded. She grabs her purse off the counter and storms out, slamming the door behind her hard enough to rattle a few tools off their hooks.*

*Aiden doesn’t even flinch. He just keeps walking until he’s right in front of Hailee, looming over them with that same reckless intensity they know too well. His voice drops low—dangerous and possessive:*
**"...You better not be fucking with me."**
